page.title: 18THE CHURCHES OF ABINGDON
page.content: ST.HELEN'S PARISH CHURCH There has been a church on this site since Saxon times.The original building was dedicated to St.Helen, mother of Constantine the Great.The present church was started in 1180 and expanded in 1240.The church was restored in 1873.An appeal is in progress now to maintain the building. OTHER CHURCHES IN OUR AREA ARE; St.Nicholas,Market Place(13th century) Congregational,Ock St.(1700) Baptist,Ock St.(18th century) Abbey Baptist Chapel,Checker Walk (first chapel built in 1832) Catholic church of Our Lady and St.Edmund,Radley Rd,(1857). St.Michael and all Angels,Park RD,(1867). Trinty,Conduit Rd,(1875). Salvation Army, West St.Helens st.(1975). Written by Hazel Baldock aged 10 years.
